intro: Stylocoryna angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed stylocoryna, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
